title: ATP Cup 2021: Serbia's Novak Djokovic & Spain's Rafael Nadal lead field
description: Serbia's Novak Djokovic and Spain's Rafael Nadal will lead the field at next month's ATP Cup, but Great Britain have not qualified.

title: Southampton 1-0 Liverpool: Danny Ings scores winner as Saints beat leaders
description: Liverpool's title defence suffers a setback as they fall to their second Premier League loss of the season at Southampton.

title: Qatar: Saudi Arabia embargo 'to be lifted'
description: Kuwait's foreign minister says Saudi Arabia will reopen its borders with Qatar, ending a bitter row.

title: Elite sport can continue in England under new lockdown restrictions
description: Professional sport in England will be allowed to continue behind closed doors, despite a new national lockdown announced by Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

title: South African scientists seek to understand new variant
description: There are fears the new Covid-19 variant could be more resistant to current vaccines.

title: Edinson Cavani ban: Uruguay players want Man Utd striker's punishment overturned
description: Luis Suarez and Diego Godin share a letter from Uruguay's players' union calling for Edinson Cavani's suspension to be overturned.

title: Georgia election: Donald Trump's phone call fact-checked
description: The president made a string of claims in a phone call with officials in Georgia as he disputes the state's election result.

title: Covid: Mum's 'heartbreaking' death next to daughter in hospital
description: Maria Rico took off her oxygen mask to say goodbye - despite knowing this would hasten her death.

title: Georgia election: All you need to know about key Senate runoff races
description: All eyes are on Georgia as the traditionally Republican state could hand Joe Biden the US Senate.

title: Hair ice: The strange phenomenon of 'candy floss' on trees
description: The unusual phenomenon looks like candy floss on the trees - but touch it and it melts away.

title: Tyson Fury says Anthony Joshua has a confidence problem and predicts early knockout
description: Tyson Fury says he could beat Anthony Joshua inside two rounds if a fight between the pair can be agreed.

title: Julian Assange: Wikileaks founder extradition to US blocked by UK judge
description: The Wikileaks founder is wanted in the US over the publication of thousands of classified documents.

title: Covid: Brian Pinker, 82, first to get Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine
description: The UK has secured 100 million doses of the jab, which Brian Pinker received at Oxford's Churchill Hospital.

title: I feel 'absolutely fantastic' - Anderson on fitness, rotation and knighthoods
description: England's James Anderson says he feels "absolutely fantastic" and in as good shape as he has been in his 30s before two-Test tour of Sri Lanka.

title: US election: Trump tells Georgia election official to 'find' votes to overturn Biden win
description: The US president pressures Brad Raffensperger in an audio recording released by the Washington Post.

title: Reading stabbing: Five teenagers arrested after boy, 13, dies
description: Four boys and a girl are held on suspicion of conspiracy to commit murder, after the Reading attack.

title: Covid: 'No question' restrictions will be tightened, says Boris Johnson
description: Boris Johnson warns of "tough" weeks ahead, as coronavirus infection rates continue to surge.

title: Woman's Hour: The Queen sends 'best wishes' to show on its 75th year
description: Her Majesty said the now 75-year-old show had "played a significant part in the evolving of women".

title: Iran 'resumes enriching uranium to 20% purity at Fordo facility'
description: It is the country's most significant breach yet of its 2015 nuclear agreement with world powers.

title: Music listening soared during lockdown
description: More than 155m albums were bought or streamed in 2020, according to record industry figures.

title: Nóra Quoirin: 'Misadventure' verdict for girl found in Malaysian jungle
description: Nóra Quoirin's family say they are disappointed at the ruling and still think she was abducted.

title: Masters moved to Milton Keynes from Alexandra Palace due to Covid-19 rules
description: Snooker's Masters event will now take place at Milton Keynes instead of Alexandra Palace to follow Covid-19 rules.

title: Uncertainty as primary pupils return in England
description: Primary schools have opened despite warnings from teachers' unions and some councils.

title: NBA highlights: Stephen Curry scores career-high points total in Golden State win
description: Watch the standout moments as Stephen Curry scores a career-high 62 points for the Golden State Warriors against the Portland Trailblazers.

title: Ladbrokes owner Entain receives offer from MGM Resorts
description: The bid approach is the latest attempt by a casino operator to tap into the online gambling boom.

title: Nóra Quoirin death: The schoolgirl who vanished into a Malaysian jungle
description: Nóra Quoirin was found naked next to a stream 10 days after arriving for a family holiday.

title: Browns in play-offs for first time since 2002 as Packers clinch NFC top seed
description: The Cleveland Browns secure a play-off spot for the first time since 2002 with a 24-22 win over the Pittsburgh Steelers on the final day of the regular season.

title: 'I left my marriage after 55 years of abuse'
description: Amid the 180,000 elderly women to be domestically abused in 2019-20, one tells her story.

title: The Papers: 'Happy New Tier' and 'Jabby Monday'
description: Headlines warn of tighter Covid rules, but hail the start of the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine rollout.

title: Alarm as South Korea sees more deaths than births
description: This has raised fresh alarm in a country which already has the world's lowest birth rate.

title: How mass vaccinations halted a killer virus in 1950s Glasgow
description: Covid jabs are beginning in earnest, but 70 years ago mass inoculation was the weapon against another deadly disease.

title: Why I'm feeling hopeful about the environment in 2021
description: The BBC's Tom Heap explores exciting emissions-saving ideas that could help save the planet.

title: Covid exercise: 'I'll never go back to the gym again'
description: An explosion in fitness tech means not everyone will be rushing back to gyms when they can reopen.

title: India coronavirus: The mums who became pandemic chefs
description: India's grinding coronavirus lockdown saw many home cooks turn into chefs.

title: Are pandemics the new normal?

title: Match of the Day 2 analysis: How Bernardo Silva helped Man City beat Chelsea

title: BBC Sound of 2021: Greentea Peng goes from 'beach town rock star' to the world
description: How the psychedelic soul singer went from Mexico "beach town rock star" to the world stage.
